chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
i1: interval
g1: nat -> nat
i2: interval
g2: nat -> nat

Goal:
interval_disjoint i1 i2 -> {g : nat -> nat | (forall x : nat, in_interval i1 x -> g x = g1 x) /\ (forall x : nat, in_interval i2 x -> g x = g2 x)}

Premises:
in_interval = fun i (x : nat) => let (a, b) := i in a <= x < b : interval -> nat -> Prop Arguments in_interval _ _%nat_scope
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
interval_disjoint = fun i j => forall x : nat, in_interval i x -> in_interval j x -> False : interval -> interval -> Prop
eq_sig_hprop : (forall (x : ?A) (p q : ?P x), p = q) -> forall u v : {a : ?A | ?P a}, proj1_sig u = proj1_sig v -> u = v where ?A : [i1 : interval g1 : nat -> nat i2 : interval g2 : nat -> nat |- Type] ?P : [i1 : interval g1 : nat -> nat i2 : interval g2 : nat -> nat |- ?A -> Prop]
eq_sig_rec : forall Q : ?u = ?v -> Set, (forall (p : proj1_sig ?u = proj1_sig ?v) (q : eq_rect (proj1_sig ?u) (fun a : ?A => ?P a) (proj2_sig ?u) (proj1_sig ?v) p = proj2_sig ?v), Q (eq_sig ?u ?v p q)) -> forall p : ?u = ?v, Q p where ?A : [i1 : interval g1 : nat -> nat i2 : interval g2 : nat -> nat |- Type] ?P : [i1 : interval g1 : nat -> nat i2 : interval g2 : nat -> nat |- ?A -> Prop] ?u : [i1 : interval g1 : nat -> nat i2 : interval g2 : nat -> nat |- {a : ?A | ?P a}] ?v : [i1 : interval g1 : nat ->...-> nat |- {a : ?A | ?P a}]
eq_sig_ind : forall Q : ?u = ?v -> Prop, (forall (p : proj1_sig ?u = proj1_sig ?v) (q : eq_rect (proj1_sig ?u) (fun a : ?A => ?P a) (proj2_sig ?u) (proj1_sig ?v) p = proj2_sig ?v), Q (eq_sig ?u ?v p q)) -> forall p : ?u = ?v, Q p where ?A : [i1 : interval g1 : nat -> nat i2 : interval g2 : nat -> nat |- Type] ?P : [i1 : interval g1 : nat -> nat i2 : interval g2 : nat -> nat |- ?A -> Prop] ?u : [i1 : interval g1 : nat -> nat i2 : interval g2 : nat -> nat |- {a : ?A | ?P a}] ?v : [i1 : interval g1 : nat ->...-> nat |- {a : ?A | ?P a}]
interval_union_right : forall i j (x : nat), in_interval j x -> in_interval (interval_union i j) x
interval_union_left : forall i j (x : nat), in_interval i x -> in_interval (interval_union i j) x
utils_tac.measure_rect : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> nat) (P : X -> Type), (forall x : X, (forall y : X, m y < m x -> P y) -> P x) -> forall x : X, P x
in_out_interval : forall i (x : nat), in_interval i x -> out_interval i x -> False
bool_choice : forall (S : Set) (R1 R2 : S -> Prop), (forall x : S, {R1 x} + {R2 x}) -> {f : S -> bool | forall x : S, f x = true /\ R1 x \/ f x = false /\ R2 x}
dependent_choice : forall (X : Set) (R : X -> X -> Prop), (forall x : X, {y : X | R x y}) -> forall x0 : X, {f : nat -> X | f 0 = x0 /\ (forall n : nat, R (f n) (f (S n)))}
FinFun.bFun = fun (n : nat) (f : nat -> nat) => forall x : nat, x < n -> f x < n : nat -> (nat -> nat) -> Prop Arguments FinFun.bFun _%nat_scope _%function_scope
Fin.to_nat_of_nat : forall h : ?p < ?n, Fin.to_nat (Fin.of_nat_lt h) = exist (fun i : nat => i < ?n) ?p h where ?p : [i1 : interval g1 : nat -> nat i2 : interval g2 : nat -> nat |- nat] ?n : [i1 : interval g1 : nat -> nat i2 : interval g2 : nat -> nat |- nat]
df_pred = fix df_pred (f : dio_formula) (ν : nat -> nat) {struct f} : Prop := match f with | df_cst x n => ν x = n | df_eq x y => ν x = ν y | df_op o x y z => ν x = de_op_sem o (ν y) (ν z) | df_bin o f0 g => df_op_sem o (df_pred f0 ν) (df_pred g ν) | ∃ f0 => exists n : nat, df_pred f0 n·ν end : dio_formula -> (nat -> nat) -> Prop Arguments df_pred _ _%function_scope
Wf_Z.Z_of_nat_complete_inf : forall x : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.le BinNums.Z0 x -> {n : nat | x = BinInt.Z.of_nat n}
eq_sig : forall (u v : {a : ?A | ?P a}) (p : proj1_sig u = proj1_sig v), eq_rect (proj1_sig u) (fun a : ?A => ?P a) (proj2_sig u) (proj1_sig v) p = proj2_sig v -> u = v where ?A : [i1 : interval g1 : nat -> nat i2 : interval g2 : nat -> nat |- Type] ?P : [i1 : interval g1 : nat -> nat i2 : interval g2 : nat -> nat |- ?A -> Prop]
f_equal_nat : forall (B : Type) (f : nat -> B) (x y : nat), x = y -> f x = f y
dio_rel_exst : forall K : nat -> (nat -> nat) -> Prop, 𝔻R (fun ν : nat -> nat => K (ν 0) ν⭳) -> 𝔻R (fun ν : nat -> nat => exists x : nat, K x ν)
list_upper_bound : forall l : list nat, {m : nat | forall x : nat, In x l -> x < m}
df_ren = fix df_ren (ρ : nat -> nat) (f : dio_formula) {struct f} : dio_formula := match f with | df_cst x n => df_cst (ρ x) n | df_eq x y => df_eq (ρ x) (ρ y) | df_op o x y z => df_op o (ρ x) (ρ y) (ρ z) | df_bin o f0 g => df_bin o (df_ren ρ f0) (df_ren ρ g) | ∃ f0 => ∃ df_ren (der_lift ρ) f0 end : (nat -> nat) -> dio_formula -> dio_formula Arguments df_ren _%function_scope
gcd.bezout_generalized_lt : forall p q : nat, 0 < p < q -> {a : nat & {b : nat & {g : nat & {l : nat & {u : nat & {v : nat | a * p + b * q = g + l /\ gcd.is_gcd p q g /\ gcd.is_lcm p q l /\ p = u * g /\ q = v * g /\ a <= v /\ b <= u}}}}}}
utils_tac.measure_rect2 : forall (X Y : Type) (m : X -> Y -> nat) (P : X -> Y -> Type), (forall (x : X) (y : Y), (forall (x' : X) (y' : Y), m x' y' < m x y -> P x' y') -> P x y) -> forall (x : X) (y : Y), P x y
map_map : forall (A B C : Type) (f : A -> B) (g : B -> C) (l : list A), map g (map f l) = map (fun x : A => g (f x)) l
out_interval = fun i (x : nat) => let (a, b) := i in x < a \/ b <= x : interval -> nat -> Prop Arguments out_interval _ _%nat_scope
BinInt.Z.lt = fun x y : BinNums.Z => BinInt.Z.compare x y = Lt : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> Prop Arguments BinInt.Z.lt (_ _)%Z_scope
BinInt.Z.le = fun x y : BinNums.Z => BinInt.Z.compare x y <> Gt : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> Prop Arguments BinInt.Z.le (_ _)%Z_scope
gcd.bezout_generalized : forall p q : nat, {a : nat & {b : nat & {g : nat & {l : nat | a * p + b * q = g + l /\ gcd.is_gcd p q g /\ gcd.is_lcm p q l}}}}
gcd.is_gcd = fun p q r : nat => gcd.divides r p /\ gcd.divides r q /\ (forall k : nat, gcd.divides k p -> gcd.divides k q -> gcd.divides k r) : nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments gcd.is_gcd (_ _ _)%nat_scope
gcd.is_lcm = fun p q r : nat => gcd.divides p r /\ gcd.divides q r /\ (forall k : nat, gcd.divides p k -> gcd.divides q k -> gcd.divides r k) : nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments gcd.is_lcm (_ _ _)%nat_scope
list_app_cons_eq_inv : forall (X : Type) (l1 l2 r1 r2 : list X) (x : X), l1 ++ r1 = l2 ++ x :: r2 -> {m : list X | l1 ++ m = l2 /\ r1 = m ++ x :: r2} + {m : list X | l2 ++ x :: m = l1 /\ r2 = m ++ r1}
QArith_base.Qlt = fun x y : QArith_base.Q => BinInt.Z.lt (BinInt.Z.mul (QArith_base.Qnum x) (BinNums.Zpos (QArith_base.Qden y))) (BinInt.Z.mul (QArith_base.Qnum y) (BinNums.Zpos (QArith_base.Qden x))) : QArith_base.Q -> QArith_base.Q -> Prop Arguments QArith_base.Qlt (_ _)%Q_scope
Inductive sig (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) : Type := exist : forall x : A, P x -> {x : A | P x} Arguments sig [A]%type_scope _%type_scope Arguments exist [A]%type_scope _%function_scope
